column5: Tonight I lost the biggest walleye I've ever seen in person... It would have been my PB by far....  I thought I had another musky and all of a sudden this tank walleye shows its face... I reached for the net but it was too late.....  I almost jumped in after the beast....  A small tear rolled down my cheek and my stomach turned....  Gunna be thinking about that one for some time....  Aaaaaarrrrrrggggggghhh!!!!!!!

How did he miss the stinger hook? I feel your pain I had a Snakehead on that I just know would have been a record but he tossed me at the boat. I found out later that week a buddy of mine hooked a new state record two days later from the area I had the hook up.  Art
Know how you feel, I lost a GIANT brown today....
I lost a giant brown today as well, made me feel 5 pounds lighter
Ahahahah well played, good sir. I ate some super spicy chili today, and have been suffering a burning ring of fire.
Amagine how you would feel, if it was a Pickerel
Sure sure with out pictures it's just a myth
Now I'm afraid that big guy will post a pic of the giant brown he lost today.
LMAOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO   PS - You owe me a new monitor and bottle of coke!
I feel your pain, Mike. I almost jumped in after a fish once. It wasn't a PB, but it was a trout, so that's practically the same thing.
Sorry for the loss, Mike.  We've all had those experiences.  It's what makes fishing so addictive and heart-breaking all at the same time, right?  I hope you get (and land) it's grandfather next time

I'm still trying to get her.... I'm hopefull that the fish is gunna stay in the area and I might have a shot at getting her.... It's a wintering spot so there's a good chance it will stick around... The odds it'll hit again are slim... Bur there's a chance....lol
what do you think her stats were?
If I posted what I really think she was nobody would believe me...
